node.text: Barbarian raiders prowl the mountains to the north, and though it pains me to admit, I must be frank with you - beyond this outpost there's very little protection we can offer against them.

option.optiontext: Who are you, Sir Taron Rimeholt?
What can you tell me about this outpost?

node.text: Ah yes, I am the last remaining Baron of Amarien Mountains... but the men here know as well as I, it is in name only. Long ago my great grandfather lost our home to the mountain raiders - the Squallstone Keep.

Out there in the northern highlands the keep still stands, though I dread to think of the state of disrepair it must have fallen in, over the past centuries. The barbarians control it now, and from it, they launch terrible raids all across the mountains.

Long since, the keep was occupied by a new master - the mockingly self-proclaimed 'Big Baron'. He's a gluttonous ogre brute, as mean as he is fat. I failed to dislodge him in the past, and while I became old and frail, he still remains strong. Some ogres can be astonishingly long lived.

option.optiontext: Then perhaps I might defeat him.
Tell me more about the fall of your barony.
What can you tell me about the castle itself?
Unfortunate, but now I must leave.

node.text: You would take on the challenge? I am not one to turn down an offer of aid, though for myself - for my family - it is too late. My personal vendetta aside, however, reclaiming the old castle would provide an excellent defensive position against the barbarian raiders of the north, as it was always intended.

You will come upon the great old Squallstone Keep as you start heading north. But remember, it is not only the ogre lord who maintains his grip on the castle! Barbarian ambushers are known to descend upon those who stray too close...

option.actions: UpdateQuest=120-1,NpcChat=Stay on your guard> for barbarian ambushers prowl the way up to the keep!

node.text: The Rimeholt family kept order in these mountains for centuries, until eventually my great-grandfather, Edric Rimeholt, lost it all one dreadful night, and perished...

The Squallstone Keep? Centuries back my family carved great blocks of stone from the mountain walls of Amarien Peaks and constructed a sturdy fortress to guard against the hostile forces of these crude lands.

Out here, we're the foremost line of defense against the barbarian raiders, who'd love nothing more than to lay waste to the village of Bulwark Cliff. Our watchtowers are carefully positioned here on this highground, to overlook the valleys below.

option.optiontext: And who are you exactly, Sir Taron Rimeholt?
I see.

node.text: Greetings, friend! While here, you are under the protection of Sir Taron Rimeholt and his men. Out in the lands to the north, however, it is a different matter...

And here I stand, an old man with a hollow title to a land I have no hope to reclaim. I am the last in my line, you see? All my life I focused on this struggle, even at the cost of other duties... now my title will die with me.

option.optiontext: Why weren't you able to reclaim your keep?
That is very sad... anyway, I must go.

node.text: You see, Sir Edric had once saved the life of a barbarian man, and thought to have befriended him. Edric invited him to stay at his court, hoping to make use of the barbarian's knowledge, in order to keep the mountain clans in check.

Alas, he did not know the barbarian was crafty, and cared little for Edric's sense of honor. He prepared a plot to leave the Keep defenseless one night, and barbarian invaders slipped in, under the cover of darkness!

There was little poor Edric could do in the face of such an ambush. He sacrificed himself to allow his wife and children to escape the slaughter... Never since then has a Rimeholt stepped foot inside the castle, and things only got worse since the ogre took over.

option.optiontext: What can you tell me about the castle itself?
Then perhaps I might help you reclaim your castle.

node.text: Over time the Squallstone Keep grew into a great castle, sturdy enough to withstand constant battering from stormy winds and barbarian raids - it never succumbed to a siege, nor the weather!

Only betrayal from within would eventually lose our family our castle home... but I have no doubt in my mind, despite the many decades of neglect and abuse it may have suffered since its barbarian occupation, the foundations of the Squallstone Keep stand as firmly as ever!

option.optiontext: Tell me more about the fall of your barony.

node.text: Greetings, friend! Remember to stay vigilant out there, especially towards the north, as there's very little protection we're able to offer outside this fort.

option.optiontext: Remind me, where should I head towards, in search of the Squallstone Keep?
I wanted to revisit our earlier conversations...

node.text: Ah, there he is, the man of the hour! And here stands the Squallstone Keep, as imposing as ever... How I long to step inside after all this time, despite my fears the ogre overlord has done his worst to it.
Extensive repairs are no doubt needed, but we'll get to that. First, I must commend you for finally relieving my family legacy from the grasp of that filthy ogre!

option.optiontext: I was expecting more of a challenge, though I regret I wasn't able to put him down for good.

node.text: Yes, yes... over the years the ogre must have become complacent, but I fear he's not out of the picture yet. Grimgull still commands the loyalty of many barbarian clans; he will have retreated deep into the mountains to recover for now...
Mark my words, once he's had the chance to regroup, he will launch more vicious attacks than ever before to take back control of his territory!

option.optiontext: So, actually... you're saying I only made him more angry?
What scale of attacks should we be expecting?
Well, the Keep is yours - what now?

node.text: I must assess the damage that has been done to my home. Luckily I brought talented men of the crafts with me. I only hope their skills will prove enough to recover the castle...
Err, that's quite likely, yes... but your victory was not for naught! We do occupy the castle now, remember?

option.optiontext: What scale of attacks should we be expecting?
Well, the Keep is yours - what now?

node.text: It's hard to say... I will have to send scouts to report on the barbarians' movements. Whatever Grimgull can send at us, I imagine will only increase in intensity.

option.optiontext: So, you're saying I only made him more angry?

node.text: After all this time... I dared not even dream I'd ever get the chance to step inside this castle again, to reclaim what my ancestors lost so long ago to those reckless barbarians...
As you can see, the decades have not been kind to what was once my family's home. The repairs are ongoing, however, and the foundations remain strong as ever!
When my men are done clearing the rubble and fixing the walls, the Squallstone Keep will be restored to its former glory! If not for your aid, this would not have been possible.

option.optiontext: What will you do then, once the castle is repaired?
What of the Ogre Baron? He's still out there...
I wanted to return to our discussions about your family's history and that of this castle.
You're welcome.

node.text: The legacy of the Squallstone Keep will live on. It will be the guardian of the mountains again, as it once served in the past. But as for the legacy of Lords Rimeholt...
As I've already mentioned, I am the last in my line and time has worn me down... I wish to remain here for the rest of my days, as an advisor and a protector...
But I fear it is no longer my place to assume lordship of this castle. Instead, for that role, I can think of no one better equipped than yourself - the great warrior, who liberated it at long last!

option.optiontext: You would grant the castle to me?
What of the Ogre Baron? He's still out there...
I wanted to return to our discussions about your family's history and that of this castle.
I'm honored.

node.text: Indeed! I can think of nobody better suited, can you? So long as you use it for the defense of this mountain realm, you will have the loyalty of myself and the men I command.

option.optiontext: What of the Ogre Baron? He's still out there...
I wanted to return to our discussions about your family's history and that of this castle.
I'm honored.

node.text: Yes, I'm afraid this isn't over for him... He may have retreated somewhere deep into the mountains for now, but make no mistake - Grimgull still commands the loyalty of many Barbarian Clans.
Once he's had a chance to recover and regroup, he will no doubt launch vicious raids on the mountains to take back control of his territory!

I have ordered my scouts to surveil the situation out there. One is stationed outside the castle gates, and another one remains at the barracks north of Bulwark Cliff village. You can access their lates reports there.

node.text: BRLAWLRHGHHHH...! I SENT FOR MORE MEAD... BUT I DON'T SEE NO MEAD! FETCH MEAD NOW, OR YOU MAKE ME ANGRY! HRRAAAGHR...!

option.optiontext: I'm afraid you have me confused, I'm here for house cleaning...

node.text: HRRRRR... WHAT...? WAIT, *BURP*! YOU'S THE ONE WATCHMAN TELL ME CAUSING TROUBLE?! YOU... TINY BUG! *HIC*!
INSOLENT BUG... CAUSE TROUBLE... CHALLENGE ME HERE?! HRRR... THIS CASTLE IS MINE!!

option.optiontext: Yes, indeed, the interiors could use a little furnishing.
I have a few special requests in mind...
No, thank you - I'm all set for now.

node.text: Of course, sir! I have a great many contacts across the realm, from whom I can source quality furniture. Please, take a look at what I can have delivered!

option.optiontext: Very good, Emerick.

node.text: Indeed, Master? Well I must say, you have my curiosity piqued...

option.optiontext: We ought to do something about that hideous throne, don't you think?

node.text: Quite right, Master, quite right... However, I must warn you, if I was to send out invitations, a little gold might also be required along the way, to persuade fine courtiers to travel to these distant parts... say, 10 000 coins?

option.optiontext: Not to worry, Emerick - I am a wealthy man. (10 000 coins)
On a second thought, that's too much...

node.text: Very good, Master, very good indeed! In that case, I shall send out invitations post-haste! Fortunately I have excellent contacts to draw from.

option.optiontext: Not to worry, Emerick - I am a wealthy man. (20 000 coins)

node.text: Very good, Master! In that case, I shall draw up recruitment letters post-haste, and contact the local smithies!

option.optiontext: Not to worry, Emerick - I am a wealthy man. (30 000 coins)

node.text: Of course Master, not that it was ever in doubt! I shall commission a throne befit for the Lord of the Squallstone Keep, then, and arrange for its swift delivery!
Very good, sir. Was there anything else I might assist you with? I tend to find there are always improvements that could be made.

option.optiontext: Yes, indeed, the interiors could use a little furnishing.
I have a few special requests in mind...
No, thank you - I'm all set for now.

node.text: Oh my, oh my... look what wandered into the wrong territory? Is it a stray dog, a lost puppy?! Teeheee...
We a bit far from home, aren't we boy? Bad place to get lost, this... very bad place... teeheehee...

option.optiontext: Open the gate, fool! I have business with the ''Baron'' of this castle.

node.text: Ooh, hoho?! It wants to meet The Big Baron, it does? Too bad, the Baron doesn't like to play with the likes of you... But don't worry! I got friends right here, ready to give you a warm welcome!

At long last, the legacy Squallstone Keep has been restored! It will once again resume its place as the guardian of the mountains against raiding barbarians - a beacon of civilization in this otherwise dark and stormy terrain!
As for the Lords Rimeholt, however, our legacy shall fade into the past... As I may have already told you, I am the last in my line and time has worn me down.
I wish to remain here for the rest of my days, as an advisor and a protector, but it is my intention to entrust charge of this castle to you - the one who liberated it from its ogre overlord!

I can think of no one better to take great care of the Squallstone Keep! To that end, you should approach my steward, Emerick. These halls will need refurbishing to make the castle truly livable again, and Emerick is best equipped to help you to that end.

option.optiontext: Thank you, Sir Rimeholt - I'm honored!

node.text: <color=green>*You have now unlocked the Squallstone Keep as a player house!*</color>
Greetings, dear friend! How fare you, as the new Lord of the Squallstone Keep? I trust you're taking good care of the castle.

option.optiontext: I have defeated Grimgull the ogre baron, this time for good!

I wanted to return to our discussions about your family's history and that of this castle.

node.text: Hah! Well done, dear chap, well done! With that you have truly set my family feud at rest... Well, you have done far more for me than I ever had any right to hope! You have my eternal gratitude.
How about setting up a fine banner in honor of the moment, hm? To celebrate a powerful foe well slain!

option.optiontext: Indeed, I shall see to it...

node.text: Alright there, sir? I've got charge of this camp now, since Sir Rimeholt returned to the castle. If you mean to travel there yourself, I can arrange an escort.

option.optiontext: Very good, I would like to travel to the Squallstone Keep!
Tell me about the Barbarian Raids.

node.text: Very well, then. Bear with me, sir...

node.text: Of course you do... Very well then, sir, just give me a moment...
Aye, Sir Rimeholt warned us you may have angered the ogre baron, and we must brace for his raiders attacking us... Scout over there's gonna tell you if there's been any sight of raiders.

<color=#9C8C77>*You now have access to the 'Barbarian Raids' minigame. You will find Rimeholt's scouts by the gates of the Squallstone Keep, or the North Barracks above Bulwark Cliff village.*</color>

<color=#9C8C77>*The scouts stand beside interactable 'tally boards', through which you can initiate the barbarian raids, or toggle them off, as you please. Activating the minigame will spawn dangerous barbarian groups in the mountains.*</color>

node.text: <color=#9C8C77>*While the raids are active, you will encounter groups of barbarian ambushers roaming the mountains in areas between the castle and the village. You will notice them on the minimap marked with a skull, and when you get close, they will very aggressively seek to fight you.*</color>

<color=#9C8C77>*Upon defeating a group of these barbarians, you will increase your score, or 'tally'. As your tally increases, so too does the strength of the minigame barbarians, but you may also unlock access to greater rewards.*</color>

<color=#9C8C77>*But beware! If you die while the Barbarian Raids are active, your tally will reset. Likewise, if you initiate a fight with the raiders (as will be indicated on the UI), but then retreat from it, your tally will also reset.*</color>

<color=#9C8C77>*As you continue to defeat the attackers and reach the end of the tally (30), Grimgull the Big Baron will finally show himself! He will no longer be hindered by spoiled mead, and will be much more difficult to defeat than before.*</color>

<color=#9C8C77>*You may view the specific rewards at the tally board. Upon reaching a certain level, you will find Sir Rimeholt and his men have finished repairs on the castle, and you may unlock the Squallstone Keep as a player house!*</color>
